alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Grand Isle; Lamoille; Orleans (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 15 at 4:00PM EDT until June 15 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... North central Lamoille County in northwestern Vermont... Northwestern Orleans County in northeastern Vermont... Northeastern Grand Isle County in northwestern Vermont... Franklin County in northwestern Vermont... * Until 445 PM EDT. * At 400 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Rock River Bay, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. * Locations impacted include... Newport City, Enosburg Falls, Franklin, Jay, Newport Town, Jay In Franklin County, Swanton Village, Bakersfield, Berkshire, Highgate Falls, Montgomery Center, Montgomery, St. Albans City, Fairfax, Troy, Sheldon, Lake Carmi State Park, Enosburg, Swanton, and Westfield. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. If on or near Lake Champlain, get away from the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 15 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
